 Hi Kartik,

 I know of two ways to do this:

 1: This is the more thorough way. If it is important that the contents of
 your objects are equal rather than that they are equal by reference, your
 should overwrite their equals and their hashcode method. JUnits
 assertEquals uses
 the equals method of the compared objects, so it depends on the equals
 method
 of your objects.

 2) In my case, I had a lot of value objects which already existed with the
 inherited equals method of the class Object. I wanted to test the equality
 of
 the values in the objects, not their references. However, it was rather
 lot
 of work to rewrite the equals method of thousends of value objects. So I
 subclassed JUnit and wrote an own 'assertValueEquals', which traverses the
 whole
 hierarchy of two given classes and compares only the Types (String,
 integer
 etc.) which hold the 'value' of my objects.

Hope that helps,

Jie



                                                                                                    
                    "kartikdg"                                                                      
                    <kartik_dinakar@s        An:     junit@yahoogroups.com                          
                    atyam.com>               Kopie:  (Blindkopie: Jie Mei/mummert/de)               
                                             Thema:  [junit] Object comparison using assertEquals   
                    20.05.2003 06:52                                                                
                    Bitte antworten                                                                 
                    an junit                                                                        
                                                                                                    
                                                                                                    




Hi,
I would like to deep compare 2 objects (expectedResult and
actualResult)
using JUnit.

JUnit provides an interface called assertEquals(Object o1, Object o2)
which compares 2 obects by reference and does not perform a deep
comparison.

Since the expectedResult and actualResult will never have the same
reference, does anyone have any idea on how to perform a deep
comparison comparing the values of 2 objects) ?

Cheers
Kartik
